How to Install transcriber on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • transcriber

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install transcriber on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing transcriber on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall transcriber in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install transcriber, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install transcriber Using apt

To install transcriber in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install transcriber using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install transcriber

The installation of transcriber might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install transcriber Using apt-get

To install transcriber using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install transcriber.

sudo apt-get -y install transcriber

Install transcriber Using Synaptic

To install transcriber using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install transcriber on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for transcriber. This will display the transcriber package in the package window, now to install transcriber, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the transcriber package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of transcriber.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install transcriber Using aptitude

To install transcriber on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of transcriber.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install transcriber using the command aptitude install transcriber.

sudo aptitude -y install transcriber

How to Upgrade transcriber on debian

If you want to upgrade the transcriber package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade transcriber using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade transcriber to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade transcriber.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade transcriber sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade transcriber

Upgrade transcriber using Aptitude

To upgrade transcriber using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade transcriber.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade transcriber

Upgrade transcriber using Synaptic

To upgrade transcriber using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for transcriber, now right-click transcriber, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade transcriber just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall transcriber on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall transcriber from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just transcriber, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove transcriber

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of transcriber

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of transcriber you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge transcriber

Remove transcriber using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall transcriber using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for transcriber, right-click the transcriber package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall transcriber click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install transcriber on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade transcriber using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of transcriber then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
